name: Fort Widley, Portsdown Hill - Saturday 16th November 2013
description:
INVESTIGATION TIMES FROM 6pm til MIDNIGHT

We take you 'BACK TO BASICS' on this Adventure deep beneath Portsdown Hill. Are you 'Brave or Crazy' enough to join us as we attempt to communicate with the spirits left behind by using just our own Psychic Abilities! 

Combine the skills, knowledge and excitement of the Paranormal Adventures team with the amazing hill fort of Fort Widley and you are sure for an incredible night of spooky fun.

This huge Fort was built in 1861 to defend Portsmouth from sea and land and is part of the ‘Palmerston Follies’.

A central spiral staircase descends from the parade ground to give you access to the four main underground tunnels, which run deep within Portsdown Hill; these radiate out from the base of the staircase.

The tunnels lead to the barrack block and caponiers. The main magazine is located half way along the tunnel to the barrack block on the west side. There is a semi circular tunnel bypassing the main magazine.

It is in these underground tunnels and chambers that we find most of the paranormal activity is reported; whispering voices and other audible phenomena, plus many types of physical activity including bricks being thrown, have all been reported here.

Our team of experienced investigators look forward to welcoming you 

The Investigation starts at 6pm and runs till 12 midnight.

Tea and coffee will be provided throughout the evening.

Due to the nature of the tunnels, we advise sturdy footwear and warm clothing.

Just £29.00 per person.

name: Dorset Museum, Dorchester - Saturday 18th January 2014
description:
We return to the exciting Dorset County Museum for our first investigation of 2014........

Will you be brave enough to join us for a 'NIGHT AT THE MUSEUM'

Dorset Natural History and Archaeological Museum has had very few investigations but boasts a great deal of activity to discover.

The usual knocking and voices has been heard near the skeletons encased in the museum and video evidence, reported on by the BBC after an investigation, has been recorded here.

The Museum was established in 1846 to save the natural history and archaeology of a County felt at risk from the effects of the Industrial Revolution. In 1884 the move to the present site was made, a purpose-built, gothic inspired museum.

The Victorian Hall is the main gallery of the museum. It was built in 1883 with arches of fine cast ironwork inspired by the Great Exhibition of 1851, and a beautiful rose window.

Paranormal Adventures has access to the library, Victorian hall, all of the exhibition areas and the basement. Reported paranormal activity includes unexplained footsteps, whispering voices, feelings of light headedness and dizziness, knocking, tapping and corner of the eye phenomena.

Our team of experienced investigators look forward to welcoming you, and will demonstrate how to use all of the latest ghost hunting equipment that you will be using during the evenings experiments and team vigils.

Investigation starts at 8:00pm and runs till 02:00am.

Tea and coffee will be provided throughout the evening.

Price £39.00 per person

name: Fratton Park, Portsmouth -  Friday 24th January 2014
description:
Portsmouth Football Club has given us EXCLUSIVE access to this remarkable football stadium.

With many tales of paranormal activity from staff and security guards over the years, we decided to check it out for ourselves.
 
Reported Activity includes:- 

"The TV in the attic at the club, which used to be the Pompey Pub, regularly switched itself on and off without any explanation. The security staff would see the light from the TV through the window whilst sitting in the security office on the other side of the stadium and would come over. They would have to turn off the alarms to enter the building, turn the TV off and lock it up again. By the time they had returned to the office, the TV would be back on again."

It has also been claimed that a woman hung herself in the loft of the old pub which is now used as offices and lights in the vicinity are known to go on and off. Some staff are wary of being alone in certain rooms, and laughter has been heard coming from one of the boardrooms when the building is empty.
 
The stadium can seat approximately 21,000 people and parts of the location date back to 1898 when the club was formed. Passions run high at this much loved club, and the fans are some of the most loyal and dedicated in the country.
 
We have unrestricted access to all areas of the stadium, (apart from the actual pitch). We are looking for just a maximum of 25 to spend the night with us.


Teams will be lead by experienced paranormal investigators.

Investigation times are 8pm until 2am.

Tea and Coffee will be provided throughout the night.

Price £55 per person.

PARANORMAL GROUP ENQUIRIES SHOULD BE MADE TO:- 

enquiries@paranormaladventures.co.uk and not directly to Portsmouth Football Club. If you contact the club they will direct you back to us. Thanks.

name: The Abandoned Newsham Park Hospital / Orphanage - Liverpool - Saturday 15th February 2014
description:
The Paranormal Adventures team are very excited. A dream location for ANY ghost hunter...

The abandoned Newsham Park Hospital in Liverpool was made available to ghost hunters in early 2013 and has proved to be a great success. There have been numerous reports of activity from dark shadows darting around, to distant, echoing voices and the tools of workmen disappearing, only to be found somewhere else within the building... Empty wheelchairs are dotted about as if their occupants have just vanished. Are YOU brave enough to do a lone vigil in the mortuary?

Built in 1876 as The Royal Seamen’s Orphanage, later a nursing home then a hospital, this location has everything you could imagine to make the perfect event. With 99,000 sq ft of floor space to investigate set in 3 acres of private land we are able to offer you areas that include a main hall and several open plan wards, a school, a chapel and a mortuary to name but a few.
 
The building has no heating, no electricity and no natural light due to it being derelict and boarded up. Even on the hottest summer day, the air is chilled. Could this be due to the torment and upset that has happened in its past..

PLEASE NOTE: Due to the size and condition of the location, this event is NOT suitable for those with walking difficulties or who cannot easily manage stairs. It is advisable to wear warm clothes, hats/gloves etc as it can get very cold.

The Investigation starts at 9pm and runs till 4am.

Your event will include:

Working closely with the Paranormal Adventures team.
Setting up / being involved with all experiments and vigils
The use of Ghost Hunting equipment provided by the team.


Tea and coffee will be provided throughout the evening.

£60.00 pp

As usual with all our events, we like to keep numbers down and we will NOT fill to recommended capacity like many other groups. We believe our prices reflect this.

We can also help to arrange local hotel accommodation if needed, please email us at:-

enquiries@paranormaladventures.co.uk  

Hotel costs will depend on local price at time of booking.

name: The Rifles Museum - Salisbury - Saturday 22nd March 2014
description:
This building, in the shadow of the Cathedral, has a wealth of history from its contents and its life since the 13th Century.

The staff of this building tell of frequent paranormal experiences. Invisible people running up and down stairs, objects moving and mirrors flying off walls!

This is a unique opportunity to visit this fascinating location and investigate its paranormal past. Spaces are strictly limited so be sure to book soon if you are interested.

Our team of experienced investigators look forward to welcoming you and will demonstrate how to use all of the latest ghost hunting equipment that you will be using during the evenings experiments and team vigils

Investigation starts at 8pm until 2am.

Tea and Coffee provided throughout the evening.

£40.00 per person

name: Wookey Hole, Somerset - Saturday 10th May 2014
description:
Paranormal Adventures are very excited to have access to the amazing Wookey Hole Caves. 

Legend says that these caves were once occupied by a witch, The Witch of Wookey Hole, and it said that she remains in residence to this day. 

The 'Wookey Hole Caves' site has provided rich pickings for archaeologists and anthropologists over the years, and several exciting excavations have been undertaken.
In 1912 an archaeologist Herbert Balch found the almost complete skeleton of an old woman, the remains of some goats, a dagger, some household items and a polished alabaster ball among Iron Age remains.
Workmen digging the canal in 1857 found the remains of prehistoric man, including flint tools, as well as the bones of animals such as hyenas, mammoths, rhinoceros and lions.

For more information on the caves and their history go to http://www.wookey.co.uk

There is a hotel on site and we are currently making enquiries as to prices for an overnight stay.

The evening will begin with an introduction to ghost hunting by the team. We will demonstrate how to use the equipment and explain the techniques that we use on our events. 

Tea, coffee and biscuits will be provided throughout the night.

The Investigation will run from 8pm til 2am.

Price £55 pp

name: GIFT VOUCHER
description: Our gift vouchers make the ideal gift for anyone with an interest in the Paranormal. Gift vouchers can be redeemed against all Paranormal Adventures events. Ideal as a last minute present for those 'difficult to buy for' friends. Treat someone to the most unusual night out of their lives. Spending the night in a haunted location with the Paranormal Adventures team. Gift vouchers Available in the following denominations:- £10, £20, £30, £40 or £50 Gift Voucher confirmation will be sent by email. We will also send you a copy by post if you prefer. Or we can post to the recipient on your behalf. To redeem your voucher, Book your event online and just enter the voucher number when requested.....the voucher value will be deducted off the total price of your shopping cart. Or email us bookings@paranormaladventures.co.uk
